description: Making the LDAP driver more generic means it becomes far more chatty. Certain actions cause a ton of lookups that could easily be cached. Since memcache is used for other parts of the codebase we should extend this to the ldap driver as well.
title: Add memcache support to the ldap driver

comments.content: Making the LDAP driver more generic means it becomes far more chatty. Certain actions cause a ton of lookups that could easily be cached. Since memcache is used for other parts of the codebase we should extend this to the ldap driver as well.

comments.content: This is actually a serious performance issue that makes ldap unusable.  It takes over 2 seconds to do role checking for a regular user with the ldap driver. In the short term I consider caching roles a priority bugfix.  A more complete caching method could be investigated in the future.
